bollywood.circuit: Munna Bhai's loyal right hand. Known for his black kurta and gold chain. Always ready with a 'Bhai, tension nahi lene ka'.
bollywood.mogambo: The villain who was very happy. He wore a blonde wig and a strange costume. His catchphrase is legendary in Indian cinema.
bollywood.gabbar: The dacoit who asked 'Kitne aadmi the?'. Terrorized Ramgarh from his rocky hideout. His laughter still echoes in the ravines.
bollywood.basanti: She talks non-stop and drives a tonga. Veeru's love interest who danced on glass. Don't ask her name, just call her by her profession.
bollywood.ddlj: The longest-running romance in Maratha Mandir. Raj and Simran's train journey changed everything. 'Jaa Simran jaa' is the iconic line.
bollywood.babubhaiya: The landlord with the thick glasses and dhoti. Always fighting with Raju and Shyam. 'Utha le re baba' is his desperate prayer.
bollywood.gogo: The crime master who is Mogambo's nephew. He plays with marbles and demands his cape back. 'Aaya hoon toh kuch toh leke jaunga'.
bollywood.majnubhai: The painting genius who loves horses. Uday Shetty's partner in crime and comedy. He wants to be a serious don but ends up painting.
bollywood.udayshetty: The control freak don with a limp. He wants to get his sister married into a decent family. 'Control Uday, control' is his mantra.
bollywood.vasooli: The guy who comes to collect money. Big guy, small brain, always gets tricked. Part of the Golmaal crew.
bollywood.khiladi: Akshay Kumar's action avatar. He performs his own stunts and breaks bones. The definitive action hero of the 90s.
bollywood.shahenshah: The vigilante with the iron arm. By day he is a corrupt cop, by night a savior. 'Rishte mein toh hum tumhare baap lagte hain'.
bollywood.don: The police from 11 countries are looking for him. Catching him is not just difficult, it's impossible. He likes his wild cats and his enemies close.
bollywood.karanarjun: Two brothers who reincarnated to take revenge. Their mother waited for them for years. 'Mere Karan Arjun aayenge' was the prophecy.
bollywood.munni: She became infamous for her dance number. Zandu Balm was mentioned in her song. A massive hit item number from Dabangg.

bombay.vadapav: The burger of Mumbai. A potato fritter inside a soft bun with chutney. The city runs on this cheap and tasty fuel.
bombay.marinedrive: The Queen's Necklace. A C-shaped boulevard along the coast. Perfect for late-night drives and sitting by the sea.
bombay.localtrain: The lifeline of the city. It's crowded, sweaty, but gets you there. Virar Fast is a daily battle for survival.
bombay.dabbawala: The lunchbox delivery network with Six Sigma accuracy. They deliver home-cooked food to offices. Prince Charles met them.
bombay.gateway: The monument built for a King's visit. It stands facing the Arabian Sea. The Taj Hotel is right next to it.
bombay.chorbazaar: The market of thieves. You might find your own stolen shoes here. A treasure trove for antiques and vintage items.
bombay.colaba: The touristy southern tip of the city. Home to Leopold Cafe and street shopping. A mix of old colonial charm and modern buzz.
bombay.bandstand: The promenade where Shah Rukh Khan lives. Couples sit on the rocks facing the sea. A popular spot for star gazing.
bombay.autorickshaw: The three-wheeled king of the suburbs. They will refuse to go where you want. 'Meter down' is a rare luxury.
bombay.cuttingchai: Half a glass of strong, sweet tea. The fuel for every conversation and break. Served in small glasses at every tapri.
bombay.monsoon: When the city stops and the rains take over. Flooded streets, umbrellas, and bhajiyas. The romantic yet chaotic season.
bombay.ganpati: The elephant god's festival. The city dances on the streets for ten days. 'Ganpati Bappa Morya' echoes everywhere.
bombay.vts: The historic railway station, formerly VT. A UNESCO World Heritage site with gothic architecture. The heart of the railway network.
bombay.linkroad: The road connecting the suburbs. Famous for traffic jams and shopping malls. A lifeline for the western suburbs.
bombay.sealink: The bridge over the sea connecting Bandra and Worli. A modern engineering marvel. Saves time but costs a toll.

tech.unicorn: A startup valued at over a billion dollars. Rare and magical, but becoming common. Every founder's dream status.
tech.funding: The money juice that keeps startups alive. VC money poured into growth. 'We just closed our Series A'.
tech.bengaluru: The Silicon Valley of India. Traffic jams and tech parks. Everyone here is building an app or a startup.
tech.cofounder: The partner who shares the struggle. One builds, the other sells. Finding a good one is harder than marriage.
tech.equity: A slice of the company pie. Given to employees instead of high salaries. Worthless paper or a lottery ticket?
tech.burnrate: How fast the money is disappearing. A high one means death is approaching. Keep it low to survive the winter.
tech.mvp: Minimum Viable Product. The ugliest version that still works. Ship it fast and fix it later.
tech.pivot: Changing the entire business model. When the original idea fails, you turn. 'We are now an AI company'.
tech.seriesa: The first big round of venture capital. Now you have to actually grow. The party is over, the work begins.
tech.angelinvestor: A rich individual who bets on your idea early. They give you the first check. Usually a successful founder themselves.
tech.pitchdeck: The slides you show to investors. Needs a hockey stick graph. 'We are the Uber for X'.
tech.valuation: What the investors think your company is worth. A vanity metric for many. 'We are a decacorn now'.
tech.bootstrap: Building without outside money. Eating ramen and saving every penny. You own 100% but you grow slow.
tech.hiring: Finding talent is the hardest job. 'We are looking for 10x engineers'. The war for talent is real.
tech.layoff: The dark side of the tech world. 'Restructuring' the team. A Zoom call you never want to join.

internet.viral: Spreading like a disease, but in a good way. Everyone is sharing it. 1 million views in an hour.
internet.meme: A funny image with text that explains life. The language of the internet. Doge, Pepe, and Drake know it well.
internet.troll: Someone who comments just to annoy you. Don't feed them. They live under the bridge of the internet.
internet.influencer: They get paid to post photos. 'Link in bio' is their catchphrase. Living the dream life, or faking it?
internet.reel: Short videos that steal your time. You scroll for one minute, and an hour passes. Dancing trends and life hacks.
internet.hashtag: The pound sign used to tag topics. #Trending. Helps you find what everyone is talking about.
internet.clickbait: A headline that lies to you. 'You won't believe what happened next'. Designed to make you click.
internet.algorithm: The invisible robot that decides what you see. It knows you better than you know yourself. Blame it for your addiction.
internet.cringe: Second-hand embarrassment. Watching someone try too hard. It makes you want to look away.
internet.follower: Someone who subscribes to your updates. A metric of popularity. 'I have 10k followers on Insta'.
internet.subscribe: The button you smash to support a creator. 'Don't forget to like and subscribe'. The bell icon is next.
internet.dm: Direct Message. Sliding into them requires confidence. 'Check your DMs'.
internet.story: A photo or video that disappears in 24 hours. A glimpse into daily life. The ring around the profile picture.
internet.thread: A series of connected tweets. 'A thread ðŸ§µ'. Used for long rants or explanations.
internet.ratio: When the replies are more than the likes. Usually means a bad take. 'L + Ratio'.

food.biryani: The king of rice dishes. Spiced meat and rice cooked to perfection. Hyderabadi or Lucknowi, the debate never ends.
food.panipuri: Crispy balls filled with spicy water. You have to eat it whole. The hygiene is questionable, but the taste is divine.
food.dosa: A crispy crepe made from fermented batter. Served with sambar and chutney. A South Indian staple loved everywhere.
food.samosa: A triangular pastry filled with spiced potatoes. The perfect tea-time snack. Best eaten hot with chutney.
food.butterchicken: Chicken cooked in a creamy tomato sauce. Invented in Delhi. The global ambassador of Indian food.
food.momos: Steamed dumplings from the Himalayas. Served with spicy red chutney. Delhi's favorite street food.
food.jalebi: A spiral sweet soaked in sugar syrup. Crispy, sticky, and orange. often eaten with fafda or rabri.
food.chai: Tea boiled with milk, sugar, and spices. Not 'Chai Tea', just Chai. The solution to every headache.
food.lassi: A thick yogurt drink, sweet or salty. Often topped with cream (malai). A heavy glass puts you to sleep.
food.pavbhaji: Mashed vegetables cooked in butter. Served with buttered bread rolls. A Mumbai street food classic.
food.cholebhature: Spicy chickpeas with fried bread. A heavy breakfast from Punjab. You need a nap after this.
food.rasgulla: Spongy white balls soaked in syrup. A Bengali sweet made from chhena. Squeaky and sweet.
food.gulabjamun: Deep-fried milk solids soaked in syrup. The classic Indian dessert. Warm and soft, melts in your mouth.
food.maggi: Instant noodles that take 2 minutes (lies). The midnight snack of every student. Everyone has their own recipe.
food.thali: A platter with a little bit of everything. Roti, rice, dal, sabzi, sweet. The complete meal experience.
